content.webTitle: On their way to the Worlds

fields.headline: On their way to the Worlds
fields.bodyText: In the running Dwain Chambers 100 metres His up-and-down season in the 100m continues as he again looked like the Chambers of 2002, storming to victory over a top-class field. Needs to transfer this form to meetings abroad. Steve Backley Javelin Still chasing that first world javelin title, and victory in his first major competition of the year will raise his hopes that this may finally be the year. Mark Lewis-Francis 100 metres Searching for the form he showed at the start of the season and his confidence suffered another knock with this defeat to Chambers. Still young and has time to come good in Paris. Jonathan Edwards Triple jump Defeat to rival Christian Olsson and a back injury made this an unhappy start to the season for Edwards. But he continues to produce triple jumps beyond what most of the rest of the world can achieve. Outside chances Darren Campbell 200 metres A good performance in the 100m, finishing third, was offset for the Olympic silver medallist by disappointment in finishing fourth in the 200m. But he thrives in major competitions. Kelly Holmes 1500 metres Running the 3,000m to boost her stamina in Gateshead, Holmes struggled but will draw more comfort from her 1500m performance in Rome on Friday when she ran a time she has beaten only once in the past six years.
